a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: The Living Planet Index (LPI) measures the average relative decline in monitored wildlife populations. The
index value measures the change in abundance in 34,836 populations across 5,495 native species relative to
Data source: World Wildlife Fund and Zoological Society of London (2024)
Note: Some regions of the world are will have experienced significant biodiversity loss prior to 1970, this earlier loss will not captured in this
